cetus.hir

Class Tools

  • java.lang.Object
    • cetus.hir.Tools

  • public final class Tools
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of static tools that are useful in writing passes. The original set of tools since v1.1 has been separated into four different classes - SymbolTools, PrintTools, IRTools, and Tools:

    SymbolTools: symbol access and management.
    PrintTools : printing utilities.
    IRTools : Cetus IR tools for search and manipulation.
    Tools : general tools not specific to Cetus.

    Accessing the old utility methods through Tools class is still possible but it is deprecated As of release 1.2; use the new tools in DataFlowTools, IRTools, PrintTools, or SymbolTools.

      • getTime

        public static double getTime()
        Returns a current system time in seconds since a system-wise reference time.
        Returns:
        the time in seconds.

      • getTime

        public static double getTime(double since)
        Returns the elapsed time in seconds since the given reference time.
        Parameters:
        since - the reference time
        Returns:
        the elapsed time in seconds

      • exit

        public static void exit(java.lang.String msg)
        Invokes a exit handler after printing the specified message.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to be printed

      • exitThrowsException

        public static void exitThrowsException(boolean flag)
        Selects how Tools.exit() behaves. Setting flag = true causes Tools.exit() throw a runtime exception instead of invoking System.exit().
        Parameters:
        flag - the boolean flag

      • exit

        public static void exit(int status)
        Invokes exit operation. Depending on the flag set by exitThrowsException(boolean), this method either calls System.exit(int) or throws a RuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        status - the exit status
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the last call to exitThrowsException(boolean) is with true.

      • addAll

        public static <T> boolean addAll(java.util.Collection<T> c1,
                 java.util.Collection c2)
        Wrapper for Collection.addAll() that suppress "unchecked" warnings. Pass writers are responsible for assuring type safety when using this wrapper.
